previous_statement: Differentiating: d/dt Tr(A(t)_+) = d/dt Tr[P_gamma(t) A(t)] = Tr[P_gamma(t) dot_A(t)] since dot_P_gamma(t) contributes terms that vanish at the boundary (eigenvalues crossing zero contribute measure zero). Here dot_A(t) = delta_AB - gamma(1_A ⊗ delta_B).
new_statement: Differentiating via the product rule: d/dt Tr(A(t)_+) = d/dt Tr[P_gamma(t) A(t)] = Tr[dP_gamma/dt · A(t)] + Tr[P_gamma(t) · dot_A(t)]. By node 1.5.2, at generic gamma no eigenvalue of A(t) is zero, so P_gamma(t) is locally constant in t, giving dP_gamma/dt = 0. Therefore d/dt Tr(A(t)_+) = Tr[P_gamma(t) dot_A(t)]. Here dot_A(t) = delta_AB - gamma(1_A ⊗ delta_B).
